Introduction: Hello, I'm Prasu Hirpara, a Full Stack Developer with a strong expertise in backend technologies like Node.js, Express.js, Redis, and Kafka. On the frontend, I work with React and Next.js to build dynamic and engaging user experiences.

I am passionate about problem-solving and competitive programming, often practicing on LeetCode. My curiosity has driven me to work on diverse projects such as crafting Chrome extensions, developing JavaScript modules, and creating full-stack applications. I love exploring new technologies and continuously seek opportunities to expand my skills.
Recently, I contributed to the GirlScript Summer of Code and Hacktoberfest, which helped me further refine my coding abilities and collaborate with the open-source community.
Let's connect and explore opportunities to collaborate on exciting ventures together

Projects.title: Alumni Architect
Projects.description: Alumni Architect is a networking platform connecting alumni and students from technical institutions. It streamlines interactions, ensures authenticity, and enhances engagement through structured career guidance, mentorship, and opportunity sharing, addressing fragmented systems and unorganized communications with advanced technology-driven solutions.

Projects.title: StockTracker Hub
Projects.description: Stocks Watchlist Manager is a project which helps people to analyze, create, and update watchlists as they want. It provides real-time stock tracking, customizable alerts, and detailed analytics, offering users comprehensive tools for effective investment management.

Projects.title: Spend Wise
Projects.description: Expense Manager is a Flutter-based app built with Dart and Firebase, designed to track credit and debit transactions. It features intuitive graphs, detailed insights, and user-friendly tools for effective expense analysis and budgeting, enhancing financial awareness.

Projects.title: DSA kit
Projects.description: DSAKIT is a JavaScript project offering a comprehensive library of data structures and algorithms. It includes sorting, searching, advanced arrays, tries, graphs, stacks, queues, linked lists, and moreâ€”providing efficient solutions for common DSA problems.
